website_summaries.verdict: If you find yourself straining to hear calls on your current hands-free setup or just want the best sound possible for calls or podcasts, the Jabra Freeway is the Bluetooth speakerphone for you.
pros: The Jabra Freeway's three-speaker Virtual Surround setup provides exceptionally good sound for a speakerphone
Spoken caller ID and voice commands enable you to answer or reject calls without touching the device or looking away from the road
cons: The Jabra Freeway is rather bulky, which limits its portability

customer_reviews.title: FM function might work if you are very rural.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third purchase of this. It’s awesome in all it’s functions except the FM rebroadcast. I love everything it does. The FM part is terrible where I live. Too many strong stations. Maybe it would work if you only have a few in your area, but it’s non functional for me. But the sound quality for voice and everything else is fantastic. I especially like how it turns itself off and on when you leave the car and return. Super easy! If you are buying it for the FM feature I’d be ready to return it. But if that’s not necessary please get this one. You’ll be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Not so great. Returned
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 or 5 of these Bluetooth In- Car Spearkerphones including several Jabra. The reviews I saw online were very mixed. Unfortunately the unit we got did not work properly. The Bluetooth signal to other callers especially while driving was spoty. Sometimes the person on the other end could not hear me at all. We compared it to a 4 yr old Jabra Tour we had and people we called said the sound quality and signal were better on the Tour. Dissapointing but not too surprised given the many negative reviews I saw online...inaddition to many positive. I returned the unit after on half a day and order another Jabra Tour
customer_reviews.author: S. christian

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great through speakers but terrible to those who I am talking to.
customer_reviews.text: I use this bluetooth speakerphone with my Galaxy S8 phone in my car. The sound FROM those I am talking to is actually very good but the problem is that they cannot hear me very clearly. I often find myself having to disconnect the speakerphone so that the person I am talking to can hear me. The usual complaint is that they can only hear every 2nd or 3rd word I am saying It's beyond frustrating. I tried using it with my wife's cellphone and the results were the same. And the sound problem is not consistent. Sometimes, I am told that I can be heard very clearly but oftentimes, I've been told that I sound garbled.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Better options available.
customer_reviews.text: My mini cooper didnt have hands free, so I picked this up. Setup was very easy and worked well with my radio once I found a free station. The device was on my sun visor less than 10 inches from my face. If I was using it in any situation besides with the car off and windows up, I had to shout. Even just having the ac on made it useless. I ended up putting it on my desk to use with my phone and radio at home
customer_reviews.author: Don J

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing unit.
customer_reviews.text: Very annoyed with this. Finally put it away and went back to my older Jabra unit (not a Freeway). What's annoying? 1) people I call say the sound is garbled 2) the *#$@ thing won't shut up. You get in the car you're hit with "Connected" 3) the FM broadcast isn't very strong...my older unit sounds twice as good when broadcasting to the radio. but the worst: reach up and hit the wrong bit of the unit and it says "Redialing" and it starts calling whoever I called last. No way that I can find to disable that feature. I did manage to turn off the annoying "connected"
customer_reviews.author: Wally Gee

customer_reviews.title: poor reviews are probably mostly due to poor instructions.
customer_reviews.text: my experience with this device is mostly positive. call quality has been good (two phones can be paired at the same time). voice commands (using ok google) have been good. speakers are good enough for front seat listeners. a2dp allows for music and podcast listening. as for the fm connection , a couple of fm channels didn't line up exactly but most did (especially if one used the charge cable as antenna). I made the on off button more tactile... a small upgrade. battery life is more than adequate. i ordered a second one... granted i did not pay the ninety nine dollar price, which does seem too high to me.
customer_reviews.author: erpa

customer_reviews.title: Better have a newer phone.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a newer phone you should have no trouble with this product. I have now bought 4 of these. The first two I returned because I could not get them to work. Bought the third one and a new phone and now am very happy with the product. Then bought another one for my wife. Takes a little bit to figure out how everything works. Wish they would put a speaking video online to tell you how to use all the features. I mostly use mine to stream Pandora through my phone all the time. Love the "next track" command to skip a song. This unit does so much it is hard to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J. Kubis

customer_reviews.title: Does not work consistently
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with it connecting to bluetooth. I would connect it to bluetooth, then for no reason what so ever it would drop the bluetooth. If I push the call button it would saw please pair device. But if I used my phone to call someone, the Jabra would pick up the call. WTF, why would the device say I wasn't connected to my phone via bluetooth???? Called customer service and they had me update the firmware, but that did no good. The funny thing is I bought 2 of these, one for my wife and one for me. BOTH are having problems. Will NEVER buy another product from this company...EVER
customer_reviews.author: Larry Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great concept - poor execution!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve returned mine, it just didn’t work great! The concept is great, have a microphone right by your head so when you’re on the phone the person on the other end can hear you well. Great concept, if you could hear them well enough! The fm transmission is seriously bad! A lot of crackling all the time, you can’t listen to songs correctly and it drives you insane! There’s always a little buzz on the radio. I tried retuning to multiple different frequencies but no difference! I bought another fm transmitter, used it on the same frequency and it’s crystal clear! I’d avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Braund

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the 8-10 year old jabra I replaced.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this product at all. I'm told I can barely be heard by whoever is on the line. I chose this one due to the higher watt speakers, but I assume my 8 year old jabra had the same because this is no louder at all. I still can't hear anyone who is using their phone on speakerphone, even if they are speaking directly into their phone. It also crackles a lot when the volume is turned all the way up. All in all, not very good at all. It turns on and syncs, so it gets to keep two stars.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my Car.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This is a very good blue tooth device that handles phones calls, mapping and text messages easily. I recently drove 720 miles straight thru and used to play amazon music the entire trip. I did not realize that I didn't have it plugged in and after about 9 hours of continuous use it simply said, "Battery". I would buy again. Sound quality is not Concert level, but it is very adequate for my listening needs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé has used Jabra Cruisers in the past and they have always worked out great. Although this one works, I have noticed that the sound quality is not as good as others that he’s used in the past. Also, the fm radio frequency has to be changed more often than normal to find a station that’s not filled with static in comparison to previous Jabra Cruisers that he has previously purchased. Although I gave this product a four star rating, it’s only because I didn’t know how to give a half star rating.... otherwise it would have been a 3.5 star rating due to the sound quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Just not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: Nice product that is easy to use and has great battery life. Biggest problem is the low volume. If you aren't driving a super quiet vehicle you will have a hard time hearing any of your calls over this device. I missed my return for this by two days, guess it'll go in the trash bin.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Kent

customer_reviews.title: A low cost and useful hands-free tool.
customer_reviews.text: This hands-free device works very well. It verbally tells you that it is turning on and that it it connected. This on to connect is only a few seconds. It is a short enough time that when my phone rings, I can turn on the Jabra, it quickly connects and I say the word "answer" to answer the call. This is quicker than pulling the phone out of my pocket and swiping answer. My company vehicle does not have bluetooth. I use the Jabra speaker to listen to audiobooks and music stored on my mobile phone. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BILL O'NEILL

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is great. Sound quality is less than acceptable. Its pairs to the phone easily. Voice recognition is terrible. Voice menu is useless. The linguistics operation does not perform at all. I cant even rate the voice recognition a 1 star its that bad. Jabra normally makes good products but this one is sub-standard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality for music is underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Tried this for a few days to play music from my phone in my car because my car has no bluetooth. It was easy to set up and put it right on my visor. But you can't turn the volume up past a certain point without getting static. And that volume is definitely not loud enough over traffic sounds. It sounds very monotone, not a stereo quality sound at all. Too much trouble to return. I won't be buying Jabra again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L

customer_reviews.title: Easy, clear, basic tool that does a GOOD job
customer_reviews.text: I've bought quite a few of these, even giving one to my daughter, and replacing one that was dropped. It is JUST the right tool for hands free ... it triggers bluetooth when you "jostle" the car getting in ... so by the time you sit, the device has woken up and said "connected". Ignore the FM radio, it's generally pointless ... but in this day and age -- with cars that connect to phones, this is really JUST for the hands-free. You can answer by saying "answer" -- and it lets me give voice commands to my iphone (call joe at mobile). Get this one -- it's the one. Simple and friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Great for my no Bluetooth RV
customer_reviews.text: I have a class C RV with a complex radio / camera system that is just old enough it isn't Bluetooth capable. This works great clipped to the visor. If I forget to turn it off it goes to sleep and keeps its charge long enough that it has never died. Automatically connects to my phone whenever it is in range. Great for direction from Google maps in addition to Spotify and hands-free phone. OK Google works as well.
customer_reviews.author: William Brannon

customer_reviews.title: paying a higher price doesn't mean better quality
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is crap, after using it for a short while, the battery could NOT maintain a charge after a couple hours, so I had to keep the charger constantly plugged in. Plus it would randomly disconnect my phone calls WHILE it was saying it was ON and connected. ...uhhh, I don't think so. HIGH PRICED GARBAGE!!
customer_reviews.author: dale lewis

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BY THIS JABRA - GET A MOTOROLA
customer_reviews.text: This Jabra will not recognize my voice and make a call. It will only call the last number I dialed. I can only barely here it over my radio when my radio is on very low. What a useless piece of crap. I don't know why I switched from Motorola...my last Motorola was perfect, but I left it in a rental car and they lost it. Of course I'm 1 day over my return period, so I'm stuck with this piece of junk. DON'T BUY THIS...BUY A MOTOROLA!!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky G

customer_reviews.title: Drops Calls Frequently
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this speakerphone for my daily commute - an hour each way. I've been extremely disappointed in my Jabra Freeway. About half the time now, the microphone stops working. Sometimes it stops working in the middle of a call and the person I'm talk to suddenly can't hear me anymore. Sometimes the person can't hear me from the beginning of the call. It's incredibly frustrating and the problem is happening with increasing frequency. This was a brand new speakerphone and I've had it for less than a year. Given the premium price, I expected a premium product. Unfortunately, that's not what I received.
customer_reviews.author: MBC

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth speakerphone I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Best Bluetooth speakerphone I have owned. Bought this in November 2016. I commute into LA from Orange County fairly often so I listen to music and podcasts over this while I am driving. Pretty decent sound for $100. Paired with iPhone 7plus, Siri for hands-free texting and calls, and Waze for getting me through that nasty traffic, this makes for a great hands-free system. I also like the Find My Car feature. Save the location in the Jabra app on your phone and no more "now where the heck did I park my car" issues.
customer_reviews.author: RunSome2

customer_reviews.title: Speaker phone great, FM transmitter not so much
customer_reviews.text: Speaker synced fast to my phone and it is nice that it automatically connects and disconnects when you get in and leave your car. The speaker for calls sounds good and you can hear the HD voice thru the speaker itself. I have been unable to find out if the FM capabilities for streaming music from your smart phone can be used with any other station besides 88.1. The Bluetooth connection is ok and works 75% of the time. However when the reception starts to go, it is useless as an FM transmitter. This may be overcome by selecting another frequency but this does not seem to be an option for this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolute garbage. You can make successful calls 50% of the time at speeds less than 55 mph. The recipient at the other end of the phone frequently complains that it sounds like I'm talking into a pile of gravel. It also recently stopped charging. The speakers are way too quiet, I have to put my head right next to the unit to make a call while driving. Reached out to jabra for help and they have not responded.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money this turned out to be. The first question I was asked by the person on the other end of the line was, "You got a hair dryer running there?" So zero stars on the "noise cancellation" attempt of a feature. And the sound coming out of it is just awful too. It's hard to understand the conversation and turning up the volume just makes the audio all distorted and scratchy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gilhooly

customer_reviews.title: Be ready for your callers to experience feedback.
customer_reviews.text: I am a district manager, driving about 800 - 1,000 miles per week. The radio/Bluetooth system went out on my car and was going to cost $1.000 to fix. Since I had over 200,000 miles on my car, I decided that I could use Bluetooth phone systems and my Amazon Tap speaker (for music) and not replace the phone system. I ordered this and today I ordered a different one. So many people have problems with feedback or say I sound like I am "under water"! Don't get me wrong, many calls are fine but way too many aren't. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought an older truck that didn't have hands free capability. I was looking at $400+ to get a radio in my work vehicle. The Jabra Freeway saved me hundreds of dollars and exceeds my needs. I had a Tour before, but the Freeway has so many more features. Its an excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Loser
customer_reviews.text: Went through a couple of Motorola roadster twos over the last decade, always performed perfectly. Unfortunately they don’t make that model anymore. Tried the Jabra because I was a fan of their Bluetooth headsets. Unfortunately this was a pain in the neck, kept dropping my phone, kept dropping my calls, Had trouble finding a clean fm station. I ended up getting a Chinese knock off that hasn’t caused me one problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best speakerphone
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this bluetooth! I had a Motorola which did not work well at all. This did cost more, but you get what you pay for. The sound is clear and crisp. You don't get any background static or other noises. You will not be disappointed. It also automatically connects to you phone when it is on. It even worked when I had another device paired with it. It allowed me to listen to my Bose and at the same time take calls. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Wylendia R Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Each time I try to use it, it won't connect or it will tell me it doesn't understand. When I tell it I want phone commands, it either just sits there and does nothing, or says it doesn't understand. It takes several trysts until it finally connects. Then when it does connect, the sound quality is horrible unless you are both near each other.
customer_reviews.author: DKM

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Works great for listening to music. HORRIBLE for phone calls. No one could hear me. When I would drive by semis, it would pick up their CB and radio. It was more frustrating than it was beneficial. My last Jabra worked for 9 years and was awesome. Wish I had better luck with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn K

customer_reviews.title: If you have no Bluetooth and you need to be able to talk on your phone buy this
customer_reviews.text: I have a car that does not have Bluetooth, so I had to get this because I also live in a state that they’re going to kill me if I touch my phone while driving. I’m very happy it works very well. I highly recommend it if you are like me and have a car that’s older and has no
customer_reviews.author: mazda

customer_reviews.title: FM function not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Motorola hands free set. This one does not recognize the next available FM station so you have to search through the entire FM band to find an open or available frequency to set your radio to. The FM transmitter does not send a strong signal so you have a lot of interference and static while playing your music through the Jabba transmitter. I would not purchase this unit or recommend this unit to any one who wants to play their music through the radio in there car. As far as hands free phone it works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Harbison

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use, but does not recognize some voice commands
customer_reviews.text: This device is wonderful and really easy to use. The only problem is that if I try to use is alone, it does not recognize some of the commands that it is supposed to; however, since I usually usually use Siri (iPhone) anyway, it's not a big deal. I don't know whether or not this would create a problem for Android users.
customer_reviews.author: Mz Sophisticated

customer_reviews.title: Great Aftermarket Handsfree device
customer_reviews.text: If your car is old enough or didn't include handsfree operation, you need it, and this one works really well. My wife has been frustrated by other devices like this, but LOVES this one. I'm not sure how, but as soon as you open the door it connects automatically and works flawlessly. It also has my phone paired so we can both use it. I really recommend spending the extra dollars as they are well spent.
customer_reviews.author: A Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: I like the convince but placing it on the visor isn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the convince but placing it on the visor isn't very conducive as the sound is okay when it is up and sound is muffled when down as well as a bit of a visual hindrance. I tried placing it on the inside of the visor and had the reverse effect of muffled when up and still obstructive when down. I now have it slid into my AC vent and it is working pretty good there but does obstruct my view of my ac/radio/time display.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Speaker Phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!!! I have a car without bluetooth phone capabilities and the Freeway works perfectly. The sound quality on my side is perfect and the people I've call say that while they can tell that I'm driving they can hear me just fine. Keep in mind that I use it a Prius which not exactly known as a quiet car. I also us it all the to send and listen to text messages.
customer_reviews.author: E. Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: Very poor product for the price. The voice recognition is bad as well as the poor user manual. Truly, a product such as this for $100.00 should be much better quality and rated at the top of this type Bluetooth device as opposed to the poor rating that it has been given on most websites that ratethese type items. I did receive an immediate full refund by Amazon upon returning. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: David Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Voice Cues
customer_reviews.text: It does it’s job fairly well. The signal to the FM radio is shockingly poor. Even after searching for the best station possible, it will sometimes start to cut out. Most obnoxious to me is how it practically yells, “POWER ON,” “CONNECTED,” and “FM ON... ____.... MHz” at you. The last one practically takes 5 seconds to finish, during which time that is the only thing being broadcast through the radio or by the speaker. The simple ability to turn the voice commands off is all that’s needed here. I know I’ve turned the FM on. The “FM” light is on. Don’t tell at me.
customer_reviews.author: David Norman

customer_reviews.title: Connects/Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product since my car does not have an aux or Bluetooth support. This is exactly what I wanted! The battery life is surprisingly good on this device and so is the quality of the speakers if you decide not to connect it to the radio. I use it as an FM transmitter and it gets the job done. I love the purpose of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ravish Patel

customer_reviews.title: Speaker sound is Horrible and nobody can understand what you say
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a $59.00 Motorola Roadster speaker phone for at least 3 years. It works perfectly. Wanted to renew and update to Jabra Freeway. The sound on my end was horrible and all recipients of my call could not hear or understand me. They say I was garbled. Guess I'll go back to my old Motorola Roadster until it won't work. I would like to get my wife one that works as good as the Motorola. I'm usually not "One To Complain" but !!!!
customer_reviews.author: HeymisterB

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product if you car does not have Bluetooth. use it in my Nissan 350z and it works really good. easy to set up and use. now I can hand free talk and listen to amm my favorite music on my phone through the speakers in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Works well....just could be louder on the highway
customer_reviews.text: I have been using for a few weeks now. For the most part, this product works well. My only gripes are the lack of documentation that comes with the product (a more detailed one is available online), and the volume is not loud enough when driving on the highway. I have a hard time hearing people due to road noise. But I have had no complaints with people not hearing me and their voices are clear (when there is no road noise). This is when it comes directly through the device speaker. I have not tried the function with the FM Transmitter. There are not too many free stations in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Degrandis

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had the Jabra Tour. The Freeway was supposed to be double the power and contain noise cancellation. The Freeway does not appear to be much louder than the Tour and I still get complaints about background noise. The FM somewhat works but the background noise generated by the Freeway to kill the radio station is significant.
customer_reviews.author: dave_g

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Works fairly well.
customer_reviews.text: Just received the unit. Pairing was a breeze and more or less automatic to my Iphone. I talked to my wife from a store parking lot. I could hear her plainly and vis a versa. I haven't tried it driving yet but I expect this to be much better than using my speaker or earbuds on the phone plus I don't risk getting a ticket. For the price I think its a pretty good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bp

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: It works a little different from Motorola one and it's a bit larger. Takes up more room on my visor and often hits buttons when you raise the visor. When it accidentally comes on, there are commands to use to shut it down. I find myself screaming at it until it shuts it down. I'm adjusting to the differences and as I mentioned in the headline, it does serve its purpose. I've tried others that didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This is great hands free it just about reads your mind
customer_reviews.text: This is great hands free it just about reads your mind. No problem connecting to my Samsung Galaxy S5., also when talking the other person here's no other sounds. Be careful if your outside your car, because it will connect and you will have no idea. A positive note I would buy this product again, because of the simplicity of connecting staying connected and use.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Jones

customer_reviews.title: I'm a truck driver and everyone in the trucking industry ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a truck driver and everyone in the trucking industry that see the Jabra Freeway. On my jacket wants one first they look strange because it's so loud. After that it's about 30 minutes of wow I need one of those. This is my 3rd one just because they work so well I carry 2 with me in case one charge gets to low. They carry a 8 hr charge ez.
customer_reviews.author: Charles e Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great option for hands free calls
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for one of the inspectors who drives around all day. It's easy to set up, easy to use and the sound quality is good and it's convenient. Instead of having to fumble for your phone you can just say a voice command. I can't speak to the radio functionality since this is used for making and receiving calls. It's reliable and the sound quality is good and it doesn't take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie O

customer_reviews.title: The blutooth is safe to use whiles driving.
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth even though it has an FM, does not receive any station and would not connect to my cars. It not like the other Jebra I bought before. If you need it for the FM, then this is not your best option.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker! Glad That I Bought Jabra!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't figured out the voice recognition completely, however I am really happy with this car speaker. Sound quality is great, and now my friends on the other end of the line aren't complaining about all the background noise anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dhamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware - so-so software!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up and install in your automobile. The sound is very good. However, the extra step needed to make a cell phone call using the Freeway is off-setting. Other Jabra products do not require this extra step - when you want to make a call, you press VOICE and you hear "Say a Command", after which you need to say "Phone Commands". Sometimes this allows you to make a call and other times it turns on some other feature in your cell phone (specifically - iPhone 7). Seems a bit clumsy!
customer_reviews.author: Bowie Bub

customer_reviews.title: Wow Awesome product !
customer_reviews.text: I brought this product as a like new product and it definitely live up to that billing, it came out the box easy to setup and works like a charm and I am very very happy with this purchased and my hat goes out to the seller!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Flake

customer_reviews.title: Very clear speaker
customer_reviews.text: works great - voice is very clear, I recommend this to anybody who likes to talk on the phone while driving, for safety. I actually got 2 more people to buy this same unit, one is a new mom who told me she bought this so it will be safe for her to drive with her baby in the car, another one is a sales manager who travels internationally and talks on the phone all the time (he actually carries 2 phones) , he takes this with him on his travels. i also take this with me when i travel and i use it for the Google maps on my phone as a GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Connie J.

customer_reviews.title: Bit of trouble
customer_reviews.text: Had a bit of trouble with voice commands. Also it would keep disconnecting and announcing reconnecting from time to time. Not sure what the problem was. Customer service helped, but the issue continued. Had to exchange for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Derf ><

customer_reviews.title: Freeway'd
customer_reviews.text: Incoming calls...Brilliant, clear and plenty loud enough. Outgoing calls...Hopeless, only works if you make the call manually which defeats the object of voice activated hands free (this could have been my HTC One and connectivity issues). The other big problem was that it pulled my visor loose (I would recommend not putting it close to the post of the visor). The voice recognition just doesn't work that well, you ask it to 'call home' and it finds 'work' or emails or another random number that doesn't even start with the same letter. Overall this is a good product and is well made, it just didn't work very well with my HTC One and my visor...
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not what I expected from Jabra.
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it three stars because, the Battery life lasts about 1 week, and when its extremely cold and I use it the speaker crackles, I have noticed this only happens when is really cold, (below freezing) and seems to go away when its warmer. All in all I am disappointed with the quality that this is offering for Jabra, the last Jabra I had was brilliant but this is a letdown.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I am on a Quixote-like quest to find a blue booth speakerphone that people can hear me well, and I can hear them well plus one that doesn't fall apart within a year. This model is the best I have purchased (one of seven different models from various brands over the past five years) - I actually bought two of them because people couldn't hear me after six months with the first (customer service told me un-paring and re-paring would solve that... NOT). The Freeway has been superior to anything from BlueAnt (switch broke after 90 days, weird interface, and terrible call quality) Motorola (poor performance), or other Jabra models.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Hyman

customer_reviews.title: Going backwards
customer_reviews.text: One year ago my old "Jabra Freeway" finally failed after several years. It was a great unit, so I ordered two of these, thinking they could only have improved the newer model. WRONG, they went backwards, it frequently would not understand voice commands and I frequently had to turn off when on a phone call because the other party could not understand me. It's amazing a product could go from so good to so bad. After 1 year I can't even use these units, pretty sad.
customer_reviews.author: Wiliford

customer_reviews.title: Safety is my main concern
customer_reviews.text: I have an older vehicle, hence no bluetooth. I don't like to talk while driving due to safety concerns etc. This device always me to communicate effectively while driving. Sound quality and range are great. I originally saw the product in a Verizon store. Amazon has a less expensive price.
customer_reviews.author: kritick44

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not sharp enough for phone calls.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact. But, person on the other end always cannot hear me clearly and distant (like talking thru a tin can). I can hear the caller fine. Speaker on my iPhone in a vent holder is clearer. So I rarely use this now. I have this unit on visor right in front of me. It does automatically power on and connect to my phone which is great. Will hook up with my GPS also.
customer_reviews.author: Furry Friends Rescue

customer_reviews.title: Frustration from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: The device paired up fine with the phone (Pixel3) but that's where the fun ended. Voice recognition was horrible and integration was all but useless. One time a command would work and the next time it would not. I can't imaging trying to use this while driving - probably safer to just pick up the phone. After an hour or so working to get the 2 devices to play nice, I decided life is just too short to go through the hassle of getting this thing to work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: J L Craig

customer_reviews.title: not so great
customer_reviews.text: This thing screams at you when it connects to your phone. When you get a phone call you can barely hear the other person. It has a volume control which seems almost useless. Can't say I'm very impressed with this product
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Wow, shocked to find that the voice recognition on this is so horrible that to call it hands-free is an insult to hands-free devices. I even tried to fake a British accent which was actually a little more accurate, but still effectively unusable for anything beyond saying Answer or Ignore. I was raised in Rocky Mountain states, so not much of a drawl, twang, or accent compared to much of the world, maybe that's the problem. Returned it after a couple frustrating days and bought the Motorola Roadster 2, which was only marginally better.
customer_reviews.author: Joel P

customer_reviews.title: great find.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great find. I used this same model fir a couple years and it was time to replace it as batteries for this cost almost as much as a new one. Purchased this one for about 3rd the price of a new one. Looks and works great....
customer_reviews.author: Michele Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Handsome unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because my company vehicle doesn't have bluetooth and my old model speakerphone didn't have enough volume for me to hear. On this one the volume is much much better, and clear. People have told me that I sound like I'm in a tunnel, though. However, they sound great to me!
customer_reviews.author: SophieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't stream FM
customer_reviews.text: This speakerphone has all the features one could want, and is really easy to use. My one complaint (and it is a big one for me) is that the FM output power isn't really adequate. I like to use it to stream music from my phone to my car's FM radio. The FM signal strength from the Jabra is not enough to give me clean quiet reception on a clear channel if the RF noise level in the area is high. This is the second Jabra FREEWAY Bluetooth Speakerphone I've had with this problem. I returned the first. The problem persists with other cars' radios and with portable FM receivers, so it isn't the fault of my car radio.
customer_reviews.author: Bert76

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: So far the sound is superior to my Motorola roadster 2. Battery is the same, connectivity is the same. Where the the Motorola beats the Jabra is the FM transmitting. They are both bad at it, but the Motorola is the better of the two. You can do the plug in the charging cable or place it right on top of the radio unit for better reception and FM transmission. Personally I don't care about the FM transmission since the Bluetooth and music streaming work great in my work truck. Great unit
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, Not Measuring Up to Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Had this for less than a month and while I can still answer calls and talk "hands free", I am no longer able to call out "hands free". I have to use my phone "hands on" to call somebody which isn't always convenient or safe while driving. I've tried to re-sync it a couple of times to get it to work correctly again (as it did for about 2 weeks), but no dice. So it works, and I like it, but does not meet my expectations based on advertisement and my needs. Makes me wonder how long it will continue to work as it does before going completely out.
customer_reviews.author: Wings

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy an earpiece
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend saving some money and purchasing a Bluetooth earpiece. The volume on the Jabra doesn't go loud enough when you are traveling at highway speeds. If you think you would use the fm transmitter feature, think again. When not in use, it automatically disconnects from the radio in approximately 3 minutes. So if a call comes in, you have to fumble around to het things connected, which sort of defeats the purpose. This product would work better as just a bluetooth speaker for around the house while playing music. Mine sits in my glove-box and has only been used a handful of times since purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: The Running Dad

customer_reviews.title: just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: What a great little device. Brings my old truck into the modern times. Sound quality is great and love the fact that only have to charge it about once a month. Reliable Bluetooth connection. Wish i bought this long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Thame

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool. I got this for my "old" car after we got a new car with integrated Bluetooth. I had gotten spoiled by the hands free functionality and I never liked any of my Bluetooth ear pieces. I happy with the Freeway. It actually does more than our newer car's integrated system. An apple person. This jabra device enables me to use SIRI in every way I'm accustomed to. Decent sound quality... With any speakerphone there can be issues... ESPECIALLY when talking to another speakerphone. Still, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Vail Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great for in the car
customer_reviews.text: This is a great speaker for the car. My husband keeps loosing his bluetooth so he chose this and it works very well. Yes, he only uses it in the car but at least he always has it. He has an on-call 24/7 type job so he gets calls while driving and this makes it easier to not miss calls....and keeps him safe. I've only been in the car with him once while it was in use but the volume was good (even for him, with bad hearing) and the conversation clear. Easy use. I just might need one for my car as well!
customer_reviews.author: Janine O

customer_reviews.title: Execellent - a must buy.
customer_reviews.text: The best hands free device I have used and I have tried several. Bought two of these now. All the functions you could want, voice in the vehicle and to the person you are talking to is very clear and natural. Super simple set up even a child could do it. Has excellent background noise canceling. The price is very fair for what it does, it works. I see so many people endangering themselves and others by hanging a cell phone to one ear, this is clearly the answer. Seems to me if they can afford a new car they surely get this very affordable speaker phone and protect themselves and others.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rhinehart

customer_reviews.title: FM Transmitter does not work well
customer_reviews.text: My problem with the unit is that the FM transmitter does not put out enough signal to overcome the station that is transmitting on that channel, and you can't get the device to switch to a different channel. I thought it might be that I live in an area with no clear channels available, but I bought another FM transmitter and it works great. If you want to use the FM transmitter to listen to music through your car speakers, don't purchase this unit.
customer_reviews.author: George Goldman

customer_reviews.title: The best out there is actually not very good.
customer_reviews.text: Voice recognition is a joke. The sound is ok but not great. Noise cancelation? What noise cancellation? :) . The FM feature - I am not sure anyone needs it. It does not come even close to build in speaker phones but the rest are even worse.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Good

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I was using my Garmin GPS now that "hands free" is the law in MN but it was less than worthless in my opinion. I purchased the Jabra and it works perfect for my use. Now I am legal!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This bluetooth speaker was a piece of junk and definitely not worth paying $96 for something that doesn't work right. After using it for a day and the bluetooth lady repeatedly not listening to my commands or turning on the FM radio when I would want to call someone I decided to send this product back, it was very distracting trying to play around with the settings while your driving and the lady on this device did a horrible job. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Conner

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: Sound is clear, Easy no nonsense use, clips on car visor. Have had many different hands-free devices, all others have been wastes of money. You get what you pay for. A couple extra bucks now will save you headaches and money later!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Casey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool speaker for a very small area but it sounds like your car has some busted speakers and the voice assistant does not understand anything you say to it. Got it for my dad as a gift and he was not happy with it and neither was I once I saw how crappy it was.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Villegas

customer_reviews.title: Ease of setup and use
customer_reviews.text: I find the unit better than an ear bud while driving, paired to my droid smart phone I can just tell it to call any number or contacts already in my phone and it calls total hands free. (Much needed in our state) it also announces incoming calls so I can tell it to accept or decline. Works great will no real effort to setup and pair. Second unit I gave to my son in construction which he pair with his piece of fruit (Apple) he also finds it the best for him.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Buono

customer_reviews.title: Complies with
customer_reviews.text: The FM feature is not a good option. You must have a clear channel FM station in your area or the local FM broadcast station over powers the device's FM capabilities. Had a little problem installing; but made a call to tech support and solved the issue quickly.
customer_reviews.author: garen Post

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great on your end.....
customer_reviews.text: The speaker sounds great in my 2000 pick up and the features and the manufacture is why I chose it but I am very disappointed in the mic. The people who are on the other end are getting poor quality reception. Unless you are parked the mic picks up a lot of road noise and have a hard time hearing my speech. I would have thought they mic would have some kind of sound filter. I will bench this unit and go back to an ear piece set. very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: jw d

customer_reviews.title: The Best Car Bluetooth I have used!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good even for music. I am told by others my voice is clear. Love the auto connect! If you have an older car you should definitely consider this for Bluetooth access
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C.

customer_reviews.title: Connects multiple phones (two at a time), has excellent audio and streams to FM radio.
customer_reviews.text: This device works great. Bought one last week and used for a few drives. After installing the app and pairing it automatically reconnects your phone when you enter the car, and disconnects when leaving to save battery. I can connect personal and work phone and use both at the same time. It streams driving directions from phone and audio books to device or FM radio. It can pair with up to 7 phones, allowing multiple drivers to benefit from device. Liked so much, bought two more for wife and daughter to use in their cars.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: My Wife Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: We have an older car without all the bells & whistles built into the radio. And this works great for hands free calling. She loves it - it is easy to use and the calls are clear, both in the car and on the other end of the conversation. She's been using it for about a week now and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Very poor FM sync
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying a better product, I have always used Motorola T505 hands free device for the last over 15 years. Finally I bought Jabra 100 device. The device work well with out syncing with the FM radio, what is the use? for having this device spending $80 on Amazon less then a year back. The FM sync is very poor , called the customer service many time, still no luck, just like saying if you have turned the Radio Switch ON. the basic. I am switching back to Motorola T 505, much better device
customer_reviews.author: VED GUPTA

customer_reviews.title: connectivity, sound , control access, quality issues, PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Poor construction, pieces already falling off, Have owned less then a week. disconnects at random. FM useless, Bluetooth poor at best. Really a waste of MONEY. Better off buying inexpensive Bluetooth dangle speaker and hang from the rear view mirror. Unless your driving a Bentley or such, open a window and you'll never hear it if it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Clarity and user friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older model for my car without Bluetooth! The sound and clarity are as stated by manufacturer! Very easy to use and sync to my cell phone! I am very satisfied with this purchase. I would recommend it to anyone who needs hands free, non-Bluetooth equipped cars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT BUT IT DOES HAVE SOME FLAWS
customer_reviews.text: Aside from some minor flaws this is a satisfactory product. On the plus side, after the initial setup the speakerphone automatically starts working when you enter the car and stops when you leave. The audio quality is also satisfactory. On the negative side, it is somewhat difficult to plug in the charging wire and while plugging it in often begins dialing random callers. In addition there is no light to signal that the charging is completed and the red charging light is not squarely in the front so that it can be easily seen but slightly on angle on the side of the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: It is ok, probably wouldn't buy for my car again,
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 10 months. The speaker quality is great! As long as I have good cell phone service, I can clearly hear the other person on track other end of the call. However, the other person say they struggle hearing or understanding me. When calling through the Bluetooth speaker, my call recipients say I sound robotic, metallic in sound, and even that I sound like a Transformer. This makes it difficult for me to call people "hands-free," and I am in a sales position at work. I would give the speaker quality a 10/10, but the microphone/Bluetooth quality 2/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... hopes for this device but ended up being very disappointed. Tried using it with IPhone 5C's
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this device but ended up being very disappointed. Tried using it with IPhone 5C's, both mine and my wife's. Getting it to pair reliably with either phone was a problem. The only fix for this is to reset the device and start over. When I was able to get it to pair the voice command capability was spotty at best. Also the Siri speech recognition capability was definitely reduced through the device. I was able to execute voice command about 50% of the time. I have returned the unit and gone back to using the Apple ear buds for hands-free use. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: R. Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: I love this device!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I sold my new car with lots of new technology and bought an older cheaper used car. With the Jabra Freeway, I don't miss the new technology at all. My phone connects with Jabra without any difficulty - couldn't say the same for my Ford Sync. No one has complained about being able to hear me, as they did constantly with the Ford Sync. It plays beautifully through my FM stereo (XM app, Audible, Pandora, and my music), and it answers my calls. This is one of the best purchases I have made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: MarMor

customer_reviews.title: Great call fidelity
customer_reviews.text: FM is unusable, both for connectivity and sound quality reasons. However, that's a given for any device I've tried that claimed this feature. Crazy as it sounds, one star off for the Bluetooth being TOO strong. It connects my phone 30 feet away, through the wall of my house. It should be intentionally short range. Great call fidelity. Very happy with battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction, Excellent Audio Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the device to purchase for adding bluetooth connectivity to your older auto. Audio quality is clear and reliable. Jabra's noise cancelling mics keep road sounds from interfering with your conversation. In my experience, the Freeway, while not as feature rich, offers superior audio to many onboard automobile bluetooth systems.
customer_reviews.author: VBaker

customer_reviews.title: Jabra FREEWAY is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: The Jabra Freeway is excellent. I have this in my 2002 BMW 525i and it does not dissapoint. I have used its little brother the Jabra Drive in my 1997 Suzuki Baleno GLX and I always found it to be too low/ soft in terms of sound and quite often, callers on the other end have claimed that I sound very "far away", but not with the Freeway. We should all get one especially with its ease of use! It also has a very decent footprint and you almost forget it is there.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but after the purchase of this unit I felt I needed to. I've gone through 4 units with Jabra and the units do not operate at a point that I am able to use them while driving. When having discussions most people on the other end of the phone call ask that I take it off of the speaker. If I don't I can barely hear them while talking and have to strain to be close enough to hear them while they are talking. I eventually had to make the decision to throw the unit away since it does not work well enough for me to use. I would not purchase if you are looking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok ,disappointed it drops connection,  doesn't hear "phone commands" but redials last call instead
customer_reviews.text: It won't hold Bluetooth connection, I say PHONE COMMANDS to play a text message and it dials last person I called or randomly chooses someone from phone directory. I bought this to give me hands free, but I am at higher risk fussing with it and cancelling various things it does than just using siri voice command. I will probably ONLY use for a long conversation and hope it holds that!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Y

customer_reviews.title: I can finally hear my brother!
customer_reviews.text: My brother drives a 2006 noisy truck and we can finally hear him when he calls! His iPhone speakerphone was never strong enough but with this device we hear him loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Very poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Tried it twice and. Sound was staticky and person on other end of call could not hear me very well Tried to return built was told it was over 30 days So no return was accepted I researched this product and it had good reviews but I would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: DARRYL KNOX

product_meta.title: Jabra 100-46000000-02 Freeway Bluetooth In-Car Speakerphone (U.S. Retail Packaging),Black
product_meta.description: One of the first in-car speakerphones to have 3 speakers coupled with Virtual Surround Sound. Sound so clear, you’ll think you’re talking to a passenger in the car. Also great for playing your favorite music. Prefer your car’s sound system? Just use the FM transmitter to send music and calls directly to your car radio. Dual-mic technology filters out everything but your voice. Background noises and honking cars disappear, so the other side hears you loud and clear.
feature_bullets: Speakerphone for the car with rich and crisp sound from 3 speakers and Virtual Surround sound
Use your voice to make and take calls completely hands-free; announces the name of the incoming caller
A2DP streaming for playback of music, podcasts and directions from GPS applications
FM Transmitter sends music and calls from mobile phone to car radio
Up to 14 hours of talk time, up to 960 hours (40 days) of standby time, podcasts and directions from GPS applications
Auto on/off, Advanced Multiuse for connection to 2 Bluetooth devices at same time, audio streaming (A2DP) for playback of music, podcasts and directions from GPS applications
Rich and crisp sound with 3 speakers, HD Voice Ready, Virtual Surround Sound and dual microphone background noise reduction technology
Use your voice to make, answer, end, redial or reject calls. With Voice Assist subscription, you can also send and receive text messages and emails, post updates to Twitter and Facebook
Voice Guidance provides caller ID, spoken battery level, pairing instructions and Bluetooth connection status
With Voice Assist subscription, you can also send and receive text messages and emails, post updates to Twitter and Facebook

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars4,995 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Note: Includes USB but no car charger
